person.persName: John Glenn (20th Kentucky Infantry and 120th United States Colored Infantry)

body.p: Jessamine County, Kentucky, bookseller and soldier. Pennsylvania native. Second lieutenant, first lieutenant, and captain of the 20th Kentucky Infantry (Co. B and H) from April 1862 to August 1864. Lieutenant colonel of the 120th United States Colored Infantry from August 1864 to September 1865.

bibl.p: Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 40-41 and 56-57; John Glenn, 20th Kentucky Infantry, Compiled Service Record, (https://www.fold3.com/image/229587212) (accessed on May 16, 2017); John Glenn, 120th Kentucky Infantry, Compiled Service Record, (https://www.fold3.com/image/273/305421658) (accessed on May 16, 2017); Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, p. 9.
